abstract: The European oil giant Shell had been accused of being complicit in the executions of the activist Ken Saro-Wiwa and other critics of Nigeria’s former government.
snippet: The European oil giant Shell had been accused of being complicit in the executions of the activist Ken Saro-Wiwa and other critics of Nigeria’s former government.
lead_paragraph: Royal Dutch Shell, the big oil company, agreed to pay $15.5 million to settle a case accusing it of taking part in human rights abuses in the Niger Delta in the early 1990s, a striking sum given that the company has denied any wrongdoing.

headline.main: Shell to Pay $15.5 Million to Settle Nigerian Case
headline.print_headline: Shell Agrees To Settle Abuse Case For Millions
